page.title: 03The Village
page.content: Roston is a small village, many of its inhabitants work locally, however some people work in the nearby market town of Ashbourne or city of Derby. The village is just farms and cottages, very little modern housing. The two local pubs are some distance from the village in opposite directions. The Roston Inn( known by the locals as The Shant) and the Queen Adelaide Arms are well worth a visit. The football pitch is also a mile outside the village along a country lane. The village shool and village hall are also some distance from the main housing centre. Despite being so spead community spirit among the inhabitants of Norbury/ Roston is very high and well developed. It is a joy to live and work in this beautiful part of England.
